page.title: 15The Old School, Henham
page.content: O.S.C.A.is the Old Henham School.The Old School is made out of bricks,wood, slate and tiles.It was built in 1875.O.S.C.A.became a community association when the school moved to its new building in 1975.O.S.C.A.was built because of the 1872 Education Ac t which made school compulsory.Nowaday s O.S.C.A. is used for Sunday School, Crafts,Doctors Surgery,Bridge Club, Libary and Gardening.The only other nameO.S.C.A. has been called Henham School.O.S.C.A. is also used for parties and social meetings when people hire it.The Old School Community Association named The School O.S.C.A.Mr Greenop from the Commitee named it.O.S.C.A.has never been rebuilt.O.S.C.A. had a back estension in 1953.Also providing toilets , PE shed.There was a tarmac playground and railings.
